data.title: Chickasaw Nation Industries, Inc.
data.meta_description: Chickasaw Nation Industries, Inc. | 11,679 followers on LinkedIn. Service Without Reservation  | Chickasaw Nation Industries, Inc. (CNI) is a federally chartered corporation wholly owned by the Chickasaw Nation. Headquartered in Norman, Oklahoma, CNI serves as a holding company with multiple subsidiaries that operate as Limited Liability Companies (LLCs) engaged in several lines of business for both the federal government and commercial enterprises.
data.text:
Exciting News from Chickasaw Alliance Group (CAG), LLC! We are thrilled to announce that Chickasaw Alliance Group, LLC has received a direct award contract for engineering and operational support with the Naval Information Warfare Center (NIWC) Atlantic to support the United States Antarctic Program (USAP), managed by the National Science Foundation (NSF), Office of Polar Programs. CAG will deliver and manage systems necessary for the safe execution of airspace management and control, quality operational meteorology, reliable aviation ground systems, and secure/compliant information systems. “We are truly excited and honored to be awarded this contract which will assist NIWC Atlantic in supporting NSF’s promotion of creative and innovative scientific research, engineering, and education in Antarctica,” said Chrystal Burritt, CNI Executive Vice President. CAG will perform work at NIWC Atlantic in Charleston, South Carolina, Christchurch, New Zealand, and McMurdo Station in Antarctica. “The CAG Team, which includes our strategic partners Midwest ATC, SRC, and ANPC, is invested in the business of Air Traffic Control (ATC), Meteorology, and Systems Maintenance,” said Carly Hill Johnson, MHR , CAG President/LLC Manager. “We are prepared to help NIWC Atlantic support the mission and vision of NSF’s United States Antarctica Program.” #CAG #NIWC #NSF #USAP #Innovation #Engineering #OperationalSupport #Antarctica #ScientificResearch

🏆 Honored to be Nominated for the SAFE Award! 🌟 As you may be aware, CNI Manufacturing was nominated for the prestigious SAFE Award by the Oklahoma Department of Labor! 🎉 The SAFE Award recognizes companies that demonstrate an exceptional commitment to workplace safety and health. It is a true testament to our unwavering dedication to creating a safe work environment for our employees. While we did not win the award this time, being nominated is a tremendous honor in itself. It highlights the hard work and collective effort of our entire team in prioritizing safety at every level of our organization. We would like to extend a special acknowledgment to our Safety and Training Officer, Dean Lowery (pictured here with CNI Manufacturing's President, Jonna Kirschner), whose tireless efforts have been instrumental in fostering a strong safety culture at CNI Manufacturing. Dean's participation in the Oklahoma Department of Labor On-Site OSHA Consultation Program has been invaluable in ensuring that we adhere to the highest safety standards. At CNI Manufacturing, safety is not just a priority; it is ingrained in our DNA. We are proud to share that our safety record stands at an impressive 4 years, 9 months, 3 weeks, and six days (with no end in sight). This achievement reflects the commitment and vigilance of each and every team member who contributes to maintaining a safe workplace. While winning the SAFE Award would have been fantastic, the nomination itself is a testament to our ongoing efforts and achievements in creating a safe work environment. We are grateful for this recognition and look forward to representing Oklahoma at the upcoming Oklahoma Health and Safety Conference on July 26th. Congratulations to all the nominees and best wishes to the winner. Let's continue working together to prioritize safety and inspire others to do the same! #SAFEAwardNominee #WorkplaceSafety #CommitmentToSafety #SafetyCulture #CNIManufacturing #ChickasawNationIndustries

🌟 Exciting News from CNI Manufacturing! 🌟 Recently, a team from CNI Manufacturing, including Zack Lidell, David Morgan, and Dylan Webb, successfully completed an in-depth training program at Mazak in Chicago, IL! Our dedicated team spent a productive week mastering the ins and outs of our brand-new Mazak Optiplex 4420 NEO laser. The training covered everything from operation and diagnostics to advanced maintenance procedures. They've also gained valuable insights into optimizing our existing lasers for even better performance. The Optiplex 4420 NEO is a true game-changer for CNI Manufacturing. This powerful 3 KW laser boasts the capability to work with thicker materials, and we're estimating a significant 40% increase in productivity once it's up and running. "𝗪𝗲'𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗲𝗱 𝘁𝗼 𝘄𝗲𝗹𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗠𝗮𝘇𝗮𝗸 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗽𝗹𝗲𝘅 𝟰𝟰𝟮𝟬 𝗡𝗘𝗢 𝘁𝗼 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗖𝗡𝗜 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝘂𝗳𝗮𝗰𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗮𝗺𝗶𝗹𝘆," said Zack Lidell, Plant Manager. "𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗮𝗱𝘃𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲𝗱 𝗰𝗮𝗽𝗮𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗹𝗮𝘀𝗲𝗿 𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺 𝘄𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝗮𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗼𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘀𝗶𝗴𝗻𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗻𝘁𝗹𝘆 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗿𝗼𝘃𝗲 𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗲𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝘆. 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗶𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘁𝗲𝗮𝗺 𝗿𝗲𝗰𝗲𝗶𝘃𝗲𝗱 𝗮𝘁 𝗠𝗮𝘇𝗮𝗸 𝗵𝗮𝘀 𝗽𝗿𝗲𝗽𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗶𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗴𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 𝗿𝘂𝗻𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗺𝗮𝘅𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗽𝗼𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝗻𝘃𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁." Stay tuned for more updates as we bring this cutting-edge technology to life! #Innovation #Manufacturing #Technology #ProductivityBoost #CNIManufacturing #MazakOptiplex4420NEO

We are excited to continue our unveiling of the CNI Federal Services’ new vision statement! "Brave Leaders. Bold Ideas. Nation Strong." The first portion of the Vision Statement is "Brave Leaders". Being a brave leader here at CNI means stepping outside your comfort zone, leading by example, embracing change, and facing challenges with empathy and understanding. This week, we are excited to feature some of our Brave LLC Managers, who will share their insights into what it truly means to work for Chickasaw Nation Industries. These leaders embody our core values and understand the impact of working for a greater purpose. Their perspectives provide a deeper understanding of our mission and our vital role in upholding and advancing our shared values. Join us in watching the playlist of videos below – Let's get inspired. Link:
